title: OPEC+ Discusses Another Super-Sized Output Hike for July
content: OPEC+ members are discussing making a third consecutive oil production surge in July, to be decided at the group’s meeting in just over a week, delegates said.

title: FTSE 100 Live: UK Stocks Sink After US Selloff and Oil Price Slide
eShandi Co-Founder, Freezelink CEO on Funding Gaps
content: Funding for African startups is a significant challenge, not least as developed nations including the US pull back in providing capital. This is prompting enterprises on the continent to become more resourceful in order to scale their businesses. These were among the views expressed by Freezelink CEO Owusu Akoto and eShandi Co-Founder Chilufya Mutale-Mwila, who spoke with Bloomberg Television's Jennifer Zabasajja during the Qatar Economic Forum in Doha. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Oil Drops as OPEC+ Raises Specter of Yet Another Big Output Hike
content: Oil declined as OPEC+ members discussed the possibility of another super-sized production increase, raising the prospects of additional output just as demand faces headwinds from the US-led trade war.

title: BOJ Shouldn’t Act on Surging Super-Long Yields, Noguchi Says
content: The Bank of Japan doesn’t need to step into the bond market to take action against a recent spike in super-long yields, as it’s hard to say there’s anything abnormal about the moves, according to a member of the central bank’s board.

title: Insight with Haslinda Amin 5/22/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Singapore DPM Says Holding Geopolitical Neutrality Not Possible
content: Singapore’s Deputy Prime Minister Gan Kim Yong said neutrality is not possible, highlighting the rising challenges for the city-state that has long sought to tread a diplomatic tightrope amid US-China trade tensions.

title: Gold Rally Could Be Past Its Peak by Year End: StanChart
content: Standard Chartered Precious Metal Analyst Suki Cooper discusses the factors that led to the gold rally and its relationship to the inflow of ETFs. "If we start to see tax stimulus measures in the US and we start to see some of the uncertainty around geopolitical risks starting to unwind, we could actually see gold starting to stabilize the elevated levels," Cooper tells Bloomberg Television. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Diversification Trade May Only Just Be Starting: Citi
content: There are signs that the diversification of equity flows away from the US may only be in its infancy, according to Beata Manthey, strategist at Citigroup. Manthey, who called the European stocks rally in October, says the latest inflows into Europe have offset only 10% of the previous outflows, which occurred when investors took flight after Russia invaded Ukraine. She speaks on Bloomberg Television.

title: Trump Clashes with Ramaphosa; QEF Underway in Doha | Horizons Middle East & Africa 05/22/2025
content: US President Donald Trump's meeting with South Africa's Cyril Ramaphosa was seen as a chance to mend relations, but the exchange did not go as planned. Also on the show: two staff members of the Israeli embassy in Washington have been shot and killed; JPMorgan's Jamie Dimon says he's holding off on evaluating the impact of Trump's recent trip to the Middle East; 25 startups to watch in Africa; Citigroup says it remains optimistic about the prospects for countries across the Middle East. Guests include: Ozan Tarman, Deutsche Bank, Vice Chair Global Macro; Omeed Malik, 1789 Capital, Founder & President; Hendrik du Toit, Ninety One, CEO; Jamie Dimon, JPMorgan, Chairman & CEO; Chilufya Mutale-Mwila, Eshandi Financial Services, Co-Founder & Chief Visionary Officer; Owusu Akoto, Freezelink, Founder & CEO; Carmen Haddad, Citi Private Bank, Vice Chair. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: EasyJet Sees Strong Summer Bookings Driving Annual Profit
content: EasyJet Plc said it’s on track to generate more than £1 billion ($1.3 billion) in annual profit in the medium term, driven by robust demand for flights and its popular holidays business.

title: China’s Gen Z Stocks Build on Gains as Baiju Makers Stumble
content: China’s so-called new consumer stocks are on a tear.

title: JPMorgan Is Long-Term in China Despite Pressure, Dimon Says
content: JPMorgan Chase & Co. Chief Executive Officer Jamie Dimon said his firm is committed to long-term investments in China, despite tension between the governments of the world’s two biggest economies.

title: 1789 Capital President Omeed Malik: “Politics Has Entered the Board Room”
content: Omeed Malik, Founder & President 1789 Capital says their firm is "providing another option for investors" who agree with their views on ESG and DEI, which he believes "destroys shareholder value". Speaking in an interview with Bloomberg's Joumanna Bercetche at the Qatar Economic Forum in Doha off the back of a panel discussion yesterday alongside Donald Trump Junior, Malik reiterated that their main goal is to "help the president's agenda in the private sector." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Qatar’s Wealth Fund Is Looking at China Investments
China Shows Off Its Tech Advances Amid Huawei Tensions
content: Some of China's tech advances are on display at Macau's Beyond Expo, including humanoid robots. The show unfolds against a backdrop of simmering tensions between the US and China over access to semiconductors. The Chinese government has accused the Trump administration of undermining recent trade talks in Geneva after the US issued warnings against the use of Huawei's AI chips. Meanwhile, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang has urged the US to ease restrictions on exporting AI technology to China. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Stocks Decline, Treasuries Steady After Selloff: Markets Wrap
content: Asian stocks fell as risk mood soured and Treasuries steadied after a selloff sparked by concerns about a proposed tax-cut bill that threatened to enlarge the US deficit.

title: Why Hong Kong’s Rich Are Selling Their Dwellings
content: Hong Kong’s rich families are learning about the unpredictability of market downturns. Now some have to sell the homes they live in to cut debt. Bloomberg's Venus Feng speaks on The China Show. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 05/22/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bitcoin Rally Takes Largest Token Past $111,000 for First Time
content: Bitcoin surpassed $111,000 for the first time, with traders increasingly bullish on the prospects of the original cryptocurrency amid mounting institutional demand.

title: JPMorgan’s Leenart on APAC Business Strategy
content: Sjoerd Leenart, APAC CEO and Head of Banking at JPMorgan, discusses the bank’s business strategy and opportunities in the region. He speaks with Haslinda Amin from the sidelines of “JPMorgan Global China Summit” in Shanghai. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Insilico Medicine CEO on Business Strategy
content: Alex Zhavoronkov, Founder and CEO at Insilico Medicine, discusses the company’s business strategy and the opportunities with AI drug discovery. He speaks with Haslinda Amin from the sidelines of “JPMorgan Global China Summit” in Shanghai. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: JPMorgan’s Chan on China Business Strategy
content: Rita Chan, Co-Senior Country Officer for China and APAC Head of Consumer and Retail at JPMorgan, discusses the bank’s business strategy in China. She speaks with Haslinda Amin from the sidelines of “JPMorgan Global China Summit” in Shanghai. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Ghana Expects $12 Billion a Year From Small-Scale Gold Mining
content: Ghana expects to rake in $12 billion a year from small-scale gold production if output doubles as planned.

title: Deutsche Bank’s Vice Chair of Global Macro Maintains Europe Optimism
content: Speaking at the Qatar Economic Forum in Doha, Ozan Tarman, Deutsche Bank Vice Chair of Global Macro tells Bloomberg's Joumanna Bercetche he remains optimistic about Europe's fiscal potential despite external factors such Germany's Chancellor, Merz initially struggling to form a government coupled with the US markets making a comeback, potentially dampening European optimism. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Southern Greek Islands Hit by 6.1-Magnitude Earthquake
content: ATHENS, Greece (AP) — An undersea 6.1-magnitude earthquake scale struck off the Greek island of Crete early Thursday and was felt across the Aegean Sea, but there were no immediate reports of injuries or significant damage.

title: Goldman Combines APAC Investment Banking Business
content: Goldman Sachs Group Inc. is combining its investment banking businesses across Asia Pacific into one entity in a move to help bolster advisory and capital markets execution.

title: Vietnam Cites Progress in US Trade Talks, Will Continue in June
content: Vietnam says it’s made positive progress in the second round of trade talks with the US, as it seeks to secure a deal to avert a cripplingly high US tariff.

title: The Bond Vigilantes May Need a Lot of Rope
content: All around the world, investors are more reluctant to lend to governments over long terms.

title: Dimon Warns of US Stagflation Risk, Says Fed Right to Hold
content: JPMorgan Chase & Co. chief Jamie Dimon can’t rule out the US economy will fall into stagflation as the country faces huge risks from geopolitics, deficits and price pressures.

title: Trump Tax Bill Holdouts Lured With SALT Hike, Medicaid Cuts
content: House Republican leaders released a new version of President Donald Trump’s massive tax and spending bill with a higher limit on the deduction for state and local taxes and other changes in a bid to win over warring GOP factions to support the legislation.

title: EU Sends New Trade Proposal to US in Step to Secure Deal
content: The European Union has shared a revised trade proposal with the US, as it aims to inject momentum in talks with President Donald Trump’s administration amid lingering skepticism that a transatlantic deal can be reached.

title: Moscow Faces Second Day of Drone Attacks, Disrupting Flights
content: Moscow is facing a second day of large-scale drone attacks, causing delays for dozens of flights with airports around the Russian capital forced to temporarily halt operations overnight.

title: Germany Says G-7 Finance Chiefs Agree Continued Ukraine Support
content: Finance ministers from the Group of Seven industrialized nations have agreed to continue backing Ukraine in its defense against Russia’s invasion, German Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil said on the sidelines of a G-7 meeting in Canada.

title: Two Israeli Embassy Staffers Killed in Washington Shooting
content: Two members of the Israeli embassy’s staff were shot dead outside the Capital Jewish Museum in Washington on Wednesday night, Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said.

title: Trump’s Research Funding Cuts Create Job Drought for Scientists
content: US job openings in research and development are plunging as the Trump administration ramps up funding cuts to government agencies, private contractors and universities, leaving some of the nation’s brightest minds scrambling to find work.

title: New Zealand Targets Investment With Budget Tax Incentive
content: New Zealand’s government is introducing a new tax incentive to increase business investment as it seeks to lift productivity and stoke economic growth.

title: Kim Jong Un Slams ‘Serious’ Warship Accident at Launch Event
content: North Korea suffered a “serious accident” during the launch ceremony for a new destroyer, an event that was overseen by leader Kim Jong Un, the state-run Korean Central News Agency said.

title: Germany Scales Up Battle Tank Brigade in Baltics to Deter Russia
content: Germany is ramping up its battle tank brigade in Lithuania to strengthen NATO’s eastern flank as European allies take unprecedented steps to deter an increasingly hostile Russia.

title: Japan’s Ishiba Calls for Closer Weapons Development With Allies
content: Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said Japan and its allies should deepen cooperation in the development of weapons and other defense equipment as threats mount across the Asia-Pacific region.

title: Judge Says US Deportations to South Sudan Violated His Order
content: A federal judge said the Trump administration violated his earlier order by sending eight migrants convicted of crimes to South Sudan, and he directed immediate action to protect their right to oppose deportation to a country gripped by years of violence.

title: Dueling US-China Videos Spark Pushback From Singapore Government
content: Singapore signaled displeasure at embassies attempting to evoke a public response, after the US and Chinese missions to the city-state posted dueling social media videos lashing out at one another on issues from the Panama Canal to the South China Sea.

title: Marcos Tells Cabinet to Quit, Seeking Reset After Midterms
content: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has told his entire Cabinet to resign, announcing a bid to “recalibrate” his administration after an underwhelming performance by his allies in last week’s Senate election.

title: New Zealand Budget 2025: Winners and Losers
content: New Zealand Finance Minister Nicola Willis had billed Thursday’s budget as a sober affair that would contain “no unicorns, no rainbows.”

title: Bessent, Kato Confirm Existing FX Views, Avoid Talking Levels
content: US and Japanese finance chiefs confirmed existing currency views and did not discuss foreign exchange levels during a meeting in Canada, sending the yen briefly lower as markets wound back expectations for a more aggressive stance.

title: Trump Floats a Public Offering for Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac
content: President Donald Trump said Wednesday evening that he was giving “very serious consideration to bringing Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac public” after more than a decade of being under government oversight.

title: Hochul Digs In on Toll, Risking Federal Funds for NYC Projects
content: Transportation projects in Manhattan may be at risk of losing federal approval or funds after New York Governor Kathy Hochul rejected US Secretary of Transportation Sean Duffy’s demand to end congestion pricing or face potential consequences.

title: House Republicans Scramble for Tax Deal Following Trump Meeting
content: House Republican leaders worked frantically Wednesday night to resolve divisions over Medicaid and green energy provisions in Donald Trump’s signature tax bill that threaten plans to vote on it this week.

title: Brazil Eases Environmental Rules Ahead of Key UN Climate Summit
content: Brazil’s lawmakers approved a measure to repair the country’s bureaucratic permitting process, drawing the ire of environmentalists who said the action dismantles key protections.

title: UK Urges Cut to Russian Oil Price Cap at G-7 to Pressure Putin
content: The UK urged its Group of Seven allies to agree a cut to the price cap on Russian oil, saying the move is necessary to put further pressure on President Vladimir Putin to end Russia’s war in Ukraine.

title: Rice Costs Imperil Ishiba After Minister Quits in Japan
content: During Japan’s Edo period, feudal lords were warned that peasant revolts start with rice. Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba is finding political survival can still hinge on the price of the staple food.

title: Mexico City Takes Steps To Find Killer of Mayor’s Aides
content: Mexico City’s top security official said at least four people were involved in the fatal shootings of two of Mayor Clara Brugada’s aides in one of the country’s highest-profile examples of political violence in years.

title: Portugal Opposes Further Increase in Spanish Banks’ Presence
content: Portugal’s government said Spanish banks shouldn’t further increase their presence in the Portuguese market.

title: Carney Says Canada, US Are in ‘High Level’ Talks on Golden Dome Defense System
content: Prime Minister Mark Carney confirmed Canada is considering joining the US in its “Golden Dome” missile defense project, but declined to put a price tag on it and said the talks are at an early stage.

title: Why Trump Wants a $400 Million Airplane Rife With Risks
content: President Donald Trump has always had strong opinions about the planes used as Air Force One, from their price to their baby-blue color scheme. Frustrated with the growing costs and delays associated with the Boeing Co.’s development of new presidential jetliners, Trump is turning to an unlikely alternative for his next ride: the Middle Eastern nation of Qatar, which has offered him a luxury Boeing 747-8 jumbo jet.

title: Trump Stages Another Oval Office Ambush, Lecturing Ramaphosa
content: President Cyril Ramaphosa came to the White House looking to persuade President Donald Trump to stop floating the conspiracy theory that there’s a genocide against White people in South Africa. Instead, the man who’d helped negotiate the end of apartheid walked into a trap.

title: Fringe White Afrikaners See How Lobbying of Trump Can Work
content: The fringe group that planted the seed for some of Donald Trump’s unsubstantiated claims that South Africa is persecuting White farmers saw years of lobbying US politicians pay off.

title: Disney Suspends Venezuelan Workers on Supreme Court Ruling
content: Walt Disney Co. notified Florida-based employees who are losing temporary legal residency in the US that their jobs would be terminated next month after the Supreme Court ruled Monday that the Trump administration could revoke protections for 350,000 Venezuelans.

title: Prized Oval Office Visits With Trump Become Perilous Tests of Nerve

Ramaphosa had sought the meeting with Trump in a bid to build a relationship with the president and boost trade. Bloomberg’s Jennifer Zabasajja reports.

title: Computex 2025: Five Takeaways From Asia’s Biggest AI Tech Show
content: With much of the world’s attention on the AI race between the US and China, this week’s Computex conference served as a stark reminder of the central role that Taiwan continues to play in the global technology industry.

title: Battery Giant CATL Will Reward Suppliers That Cut Emissions
content: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd., the world’s largest producer of electric-vehicle batteries, is rewarding suppliers that cut emissions as it attempts to rein in its climate footprint.

content: Duolingo Inc. plans to use artificial intelligence to help significantly expand its course offerings beyond languages and reach more learners globally, Chief Financial Officer Matt Skaruppa said.

content: Hinge Health Inc. and a group of investors raised $437 million in the digital physical therapy provider’s US initial public offering, pricing shares at the top of a marketed range.

title: Nike Returns to Amazon’s Online Store as Direct Vendor
content: Nike Inc. is returning to Amazon.com Inc.’s online store after leaving it in 2019, part of efforts by the world’s largest sportswear company to renew growth and mend ties with key wholesale partners.

title: Snowflake Gives Strong Outlook With Focus on New AI Tools
content: Snowflake Inc. gave a strong outlook for quarterly sales after launching a slew of new products over the last year.

title: Google’s Sergey Brin Gives Shares Worth $700 Million as a Gift
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin, tapping a personal fortune that exceeds $140 billion, gave nearly $700 million in Alphabet Inc. shares away as a gift.

title: Zoom Reports Solid Revenue on Growth in Enterprise Customers
content: Zoom Communications Inc. reported revenue from enterprise customers that topped analysts’ estimates, suggesting stronger sales among its expanded suite of products.

title: MercadoLibre CEO Steps Aside After 25 Years for Chairman Job
content: MercadoLibre Inc. Chief Executive Officer Marcos Galperin will become executive chairman of the e-commerce and financial technology giant, marking the first change in the top job since he founded Latin America’s most valuable company more than two decades ago.

title: Nvidia CEO Slams US Chip Rules, Trump’s AI Action Plan | Bloomberg Technology
content: Bloomberg’s Ed Ludlow speaks with White House AI advisor Sriram Krishnan about the US AI Action Plan and President Donald Trump’s approach to tech diplomacy. Plus, Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says the US should ease restrictions on exporting chips to China. And Google shares rise as investors digest the company’s AI announcements. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: AT&T Buys Lumen’s Consumer Fiber Business for $5.75 Billion
content: AT&T Inc. agreed to buy the consumer fiber operations of Lumen Technologies Inc. for $5.75 billion, expanding its fast broadband service in major cities like Denver and Las Vegas.

title: CoreWeave Surges Past Analyst Targets as Citi Doubles Theirs
content: CoreWeave Inc.’s rally is running so hot it’s leaving analysts’ stock predictions in the dust. Citi Research more than doubled their 12-month price target on the stock to a Wall Street high Wednesday morning. When the market opened shares blew past it in the first 15 minutes of trading.

title: Kalshi Pulls Announcement on xAI Deal Hours After Touting It
content: Kalshi Inc. withdrew announcements about a collaboration with Elon Musk’s artificial-intelligence firm xAI just hours after a top executive at the prediction markets firm touted the deal.

title: Nvidia CEO Urges US to Ease AI Curbs After China ‘Failure’
content: Nvidia Corp. chief Jensen Huang blasted the “failure” of US restrictions intended to contain China’s technological ascent, calling on the White House to lower barriers to AI chip sales before American firms cede that market to up-and-coming rivals such as Huawei Technologies Co.

title: Microsoft Touts Sales in Competition With Snowflake, Databricks
content: Microsoft Corp. said its data-focused product, Fabric, is rapidly picking up customers in competition with rivals including Snowflake Inc. and Databricks Inc.

title: Amazon CEO Says Customer Demand, Prices Steady Despite Tariffs
content: Amazon.com Inc. Chief Executive Officer Andy Jassy said the online retailer hasn’t seen any meaningful reduction in consumer spending or an increase in prices as a result of tariffs introduced by US President Donald Trump earlier this year.

title: US to Keep China Chip Curbs, Spurning Nvidia’s Call for Relief
content: The Trump administration will maintain efforts to keep advanced artificial intelligence technology out of China’s hands, a top White House official said, brushing off calls from Nvidia Corp. Chief Executive Officer Jensen Huang to ease restrictions on chip exports to the world’s second largest economy.

title: UK Budget Deficit Widened in April Despite Employer Tax Hike
content: UK government borrowing posted a surprise increase in the first month of the new fiscal year in another setback for Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves.

title: BOJ Shouldn’t Act on Surging Super-Long Yields, Noguchi Says

title: Egypt Poised for Another Rate Cut Before Possible ‘Summer Break’

title: Dimon Warns of US Stagflation Risk, Says Fed Right to Hold

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
